title: US Governor DeSantis eases restrictions to carry concealed guns
description: Governor Ron DeSantis signs bill allowing gun owners to carry concealed firearms without background checks in Florida.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Battle for Bakhmut not over, says US official
description: Ukrainians have not been repulsed from the city, White House official John Kirby says, refuting Wagner Group's claims.

title: NASA reveals historic crew for 2024 Artemis moon voyage
description: Artemis II mission, scheduled for 2024, is NASA's first manned moon mission in 50 years, a prelude to Mars exploration.

title: UN experts accuse senior South Sudan officials of rights abuses
description: New UN report says officials should face criminal investigation, prosecution for their part in abuses against civilians.

title: At least 21 killed, several missing in eastern DR Congo landslide
description: Bodies of eight women, 13 children discovered after the landslide hit a river in the locality of Bolowa on Sunday.

title: El Salvador committing ‘systematic’ abuses in gang purge: Amnesty
description: Government has committed abuses such as torture, enforced disappearances in year-long gang crackdown, rights group says.

title: US House Speaker McCarthy to meet Taiwan president this week
description: Kevin McCarthy's office confirms upcoming meeting with Tsai Ing-wen in California on Wednesday despite China's warnings.

title: Finland to join NATO on Tuesday, military alliance’s chief says
description: Finland to become 31st member of world's biggest military alliance, prompting a warning from Russia.

title: Israel police detain man planning Passover sacrifice at Al-Aqsa
description: Fears are mounting that Jewish ultranationalists are trying to alter status quo at the compound housing Al-Aqsa Mosque.

title: Analysis: Why does Israel’s Ben-Gvir want a ‘national guard’?
description: Palestinians, Israeli opposition worry about formation of armed force directly under the far-right minister's control.

title: WWE, UFC to merge into $21bn entertainment company
description: Deal unites two of the biggest names in wrestling and entertainment and caps a months-long sale process for WWE.

title: Netanyahu delays firing of dissenting Defence Minister Gallant
description: PM and his defence chief are reportedly set to visit soldiers together later on Monday in latest sign of thaw.

title: Killed in Russia: Who was fighter-turned-blogger Tatarsky?
description: Russia accuses Ukraine and the opposition of involvement, but Kyiv says 'the spiders are eating each other in a jar'.

title: Venezuela detains 44 officials in corruption probe
description: Government cracks down on embezzlement that is believed to have cost it billions of dollars.

title: Philippines announces locations of 4 bases to be used by US army
description: One site is near the hotly disputed South China Sea and another not far from Taiwan.

title: Kenya drops charges against opposition lawmakers over protests
description: Charges withdrawn after opposition leader Odinga calls off Monday's demonstration and agrees to talks with government.

title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians in occupied West Bank raid
description: Dozens injured after inhaling tear gas as Israeli forces raided neighbourhood, arresting two other Palestinians.

title: Donald Trump set to fly to New York for court appearance
description: The former US president is due to be arraigned, fingerprinted and photographed at a Manhattan court on Tuesday.

title: History Illustrated: How AI beat us at our own game
description: Playing games is serious business for artificial intelligence and the evolution of lifelike bots like ChatGPT.

title: Madagascar bans public protests ahead of presidential election
description: Government critics see ban as part of larger crackdown on dissent ahead of voting in November.

title: How will the Iran-Israel conflict play out in Syria?
description: Tehran has promised to retaliate against Israel but is focused in the meantime  on diplomatic wins in the region.

title: Africans should help bring Putin to the ICC
description: Africa’s disgruntlement with the court's hypocrisy should not impede justice for Ukraine’s stolen children.

title: Two killed by Israeli army in raid on West Bank city of Nablus
description: Two Palestinian men were killed by Israeli troops during a raid in the occupied West Bank city of Nablus.

title: Mystery baby reunited with her mother 54 days after Turkey quakes
description: Vetin Begdas reunites with her mother - who was assumed to have died in the quake - after a DNA test matched them.

title: Surviving a Sinister Sect: Chile’s Colonia Dignidad
description: A survivor of Chile’s Colonia Dignidad unites with a journalist and a lawyer to find justice and freedom.

title: Australian school principal Malka Leifer guilty of sexual abuse
description: Malka Leifer found guilty on 18 charges, including raping student during sleepover, sexually assaulting pupil at camp.

title: ‘More freedom’: Why a Cameroonian man returned to Ukraine
description: Despite the war in Ukraine, for Nelly Nelson, Lviv feels like a second home and a place where people 'enjoy life'.

title: Egypt’s el-Sisi visits Saudi Arabia amid financial pressure
description: El-Sisi meets Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman as Egypt's economic woes deepen.

title: Malaysian Parliament’s lower house votes to abolish death penalty
description: The bill now goes to the upper chamber and, if passed, would be sent to the king to be signed into law.

title: Timeline: Long road to Northern Ireland’s Good Friday Agreement
description: Northern Ireland is to mark the 25th anniversary of the signing of the Good Friday Agreement on April 10.

title: Aboriginal Australian ‘national treasure’ Yunupingu dies
description: Yunupingu played a pivotal role in Aboriginal Australians' fight for ancestral land rights during the 1960s and 70s.

title: India opposition leader Rahul Gandhi challenges jail sentence
description: Congress leader files plea in Surat court following two-year jail sentence in defamation case brought by BJP legislator.

title: Ex-Kosovo president Thaci pleads not guilty to war crimes
description: Former Kosovo President Hashim Thaci and three co-defendants are charged with war crimes in 1998-1999 war with Serbia.

title: Paris votes to ban rental e-scooters
description: Ban will not affect privately owned electric scooters, of which 700,000 were sold nationwide last year.

title: Christian faithful mark Palm Sunday in Jerusalem
description: Christian pilgrims have participated in Palm Sunday celebrations in Jerusalem at the start of the Holy Week.

title: Politics of ruin: Why Modi wants to demolish India’s mosques
description: The necro-economy of Hindu nationalism relies on making history its most important site. Muslim shrines must suffer.

title: Car bomb rocks a suburb of Syria’s capital Damascus
description: Police sources say there were no casualties after the bomb went off in a busy area of the affluent Mezze suburb.

title: One dead as violence rocks eastern India during Hindu festival
description: Riot police deployed and mobile internet services cut in parts of Bihar after one person is shot dead in Bihar Sharif.

title: Oil prices surge after OPEC’s surprise output cuts
description: Price jump comes after news oil producers will slash output by about 1.16 million barrels per day.

title: Wagner claims ‘legal’ control of Ukraine’s Bakhmut
description: Ukraine says its forces are still holding Bakhmut and that the fighting there remains 'particularly hot'.

title: Tesla sales rise post price cut but fall short of expectations
description: The first quarter sales of 422,875 were a record for the company but fell short of analyst estimates of 432,000.

title: Twitter strips check mark from New York Times
description: Move comes after Twitter owner Elon Musk posted disparaging remarks about the newspaper.

title: Kenya’s Raila Odinga suspends anti-government protests
description: Move comes after President William Ruto called for dialogue to work through concerns about the electoral process.

title: Taliban closes Afghan women-run radio station for ‘playing music’
description: Sadai Banowan station head denies any violation, saying there was no need for the closure and called it a conspiracy.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 404
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 404th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Russia to put nukes in Belarus near NATO borders, envoy says
description: Russian envoy to Belarus says weapons will be moved to ally's territory despite 'noise in Europe and the United States'.

title: Asia’s living costs are rising. In Philippines, they’re soaring
description: Southeast Asia's fourth-largest economy sees inflation hit 8.6 percent, far above Thailand, Indonesia and Vietnam.
